meanings.definition: To assess or value something too highly.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overevaluate her own abilities, thinking she can do anything.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to overevaluate the importance of material possessions in life.
meanings.sent3: John's overevaluation of his cooking skills led to a disastrous attempt at making dinner.
meanings.sent4: The coach warned the team not to overevaluate their opponents, as they might be stronger than they appear.
meanings.sent5: The overevaluation of the old painting resulted in it being sold for much more than its actual value.

meanings.definition: The act of placing excessive importance or worth on something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant overevaluation of her appearance made her feel insecure.
meanings.sent2: Overevaluation of social media likes can lead to feelings of inadequacy.
meanings.sent3: The overevaluation of the new gadget caused a frenzy of people trying to buy it.
meanings.sent4: The overevaluation of money as the key to happiness often leads to disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The overevaluation of fame can sometimes overshadow the importance of personal relationships.
